sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: companion
trans: n. 同伴, 伙伴; 成双成对的物品之一 时 态: companioned, companioning, companions

sentences.english: For ten years he had been her constant companion .
sentences.chinese: 十年来他一直陪伴她左右。

sentences.english: His dog became his closest companion .
sentences.chinese: 他的狗成了他最亲密的伙伴。

sentences.english: a travelling companion
sentences.chinese: 旅伴

detailed_translations.english: someone you spend a lot of time with, especially a friend

name: concur
trans: vi. 一致；同意；互助 时 态: concurred, concurring, concurs

sentences.english: And so, a lot of people see this as a sort of … or create a scenario, an Orwellian scenario, a Big Brother type scenario but I don't concur.
sentences.chinese: 所以，大多数人会把这个现象视为一种……或者说创作一幕剧情，一幕奥威尔式或是“老大哥”式的剧情，但是我并不同意这样的看法。

detailed_translations.english: to agree with someone or have the same opinion as them

name: conjunction
trans: n. 连词; 结合; 联合 形容词: conjunctional

sentences.english: The conjunction of low inflation and low unemployment came as a very pleasant surprise.
sentences.chinese: 低通货膨胀与低失业的同时出现是一大惊喜。

sentences.english: The two clauses are joined by a conjunction.
sentences.chinese: 这两个分句由一个连词连在一起.

detailed_translations.english: a combination of events, etc., that causes a particular result

name: conquer
trans: vt. 攻克, 征服; 破除, 克服; vi. 得胜 时 态: conquered, conquering, conquers 形容词: conquerable

sentences.english: The Normans conquered England in 1066.
sentences.chinese: 诺曼人于 1066 年征服英格兰。

sentences.english: Egypt was conquered by the Persian king Kambyses.
sentences.chinese: 埃及被波斯国王冈比西斯征服。

detailed_translations.english: to get control of a country by fighting

name: contend
trans: vi. 竞争；斗争；奋斗；争论; vt. 主张；为...斗争 时 态: contended, contending, contends 名 词: contender

sentences.english: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.chinese: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

detailed_translations.english: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true

name: contrary
trans: adj. 相反的, 相违的; n. 相反, 反面, 对立面 副 词: contrarily 名 词: contrariness

sentences.english: Two contrary views emerged.
sentences.chinese: 出现了两种相反的观点。

sentences.english: The men shouted contrary orders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人大声喊叫的命令互相矛盾。

sentences.english: It wasn’t a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那不是好事，恰恰相反，是个巨大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other
used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by someone else, or to answer no to a question

name: counsel
trans: n. 忠告；讨论；商议；决策；法律顾问; vt. 劝告；建议; vi. 提出忠告；商讨 时 态: counseled , counselled counseling , couns...

sentences.english: He assisted me with good counsel and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 他以良好的忠告和鼓励帮助我。

sentences.english: Those who counsel US privately, point out that we are wrong, are true friends.
sentences.chinese: 那些私下忠告我们，指出我们错误的人，才是真正的朋友。

sentences.english: Their free guidance and counsel will be the most priceless gift you can receive.
sentences.chinese: 他们的免费指导和忠告，将是你能够收到的最无价的礼物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 劝告， 忠告；法律顾问； 辩护人
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer who represents you in court

name: crane
trans: n. 鹤；吊车，起重机; vi. 伸着脖子看；迟疑，踌躇; vt. 用起重机起吊；伸长脖子 时 态: craned, craning, cranes

sentences.english: The little prefabricated hut was lifted away by a huge crane.
sentences.chinese: 那间小小的预制棚屋被一台巨大的起重机吊走了。

sentences.english: She craned her neck to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 她伸长脖子以便看得清楚一些。

sentences.english: Children craned to get close to him.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们伸长脖子想靠近他。

detailed_translations.english: a large tall machine used by builders for lifting heavy things
If you crane your neck or head, you stretch your neck in a particular direction in order to see or hear something better

name: creep
trans: vi. 爬行；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩；蔓延; n. 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者 时 态: crept creeping, creeps

sentences.english: He crept back up the stairs, trying to avoid the ones that creaked.
sentences.chinese: 他蹑手蹑脚地回楼上，尽量避开那些嘎吱作响的梯级。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；蔓延；慢慢地移动；起鸡皮疙瘩
detailed_translations.english: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

detailed_translations.chinese: 爬行；毛骨悚然的感觉；谄媚者

name: critic
trans: n. 批评家，评论家；爱挑剔的人

sentences.english: Mather was a film critic for many years.
sentences.chinese: 马瑟做过多年的电影评论家。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to make judgments about the good and bad qualities of art, music, films etc

name: crown
trans: n. 王冠；王权；花冠；顶点; vt. 加冕；居…之顶；表彰；使圆满完成 时 态: crowned, crowning, crowns

sentences.english: a hat with a high crown
sentences.chinese: 高顶帽

detailed_translations.english: the top part of a hat or someone’s head
to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

name: culminate
trans: vt. & vi. 达到极点时 态: culminated, culminating, culminates 名 词: culmination

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

name: curtain
trans: n. 窗帘；幕; vt. 遮蔽；装上门帘 时 态: curtained, curtaining, curtains

sentences.english: red velvet curtains
sentences.chinese: 红色的丝绒窗帘

sentences.english: Before the curtain went up, the dancers took their places on stage.
sentences.chinese: 幕拉起之前，舞蹈演员都在舞台上站好了位置。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of hanging cloth that can be pulled across to cover a window, divide a room etc

name: cyclist
trans: n. 骑自行车的人

sentences.english: ...better protection for pedestrians and cyclists.
sentences.chinese: …对行人和骑自行车的人的更好保护。

detailed_translations.english: someone who rides a bicycle

name: dash
trans: n. 破折号；冲撞; vt. 使…破灭；猛撞；泼溅; vi. 猛冲；撞击 DASHabbr. Drone Antisubmarine Helicopter 无线电遥控反潜艇直升飞机...

sentences.english: The boat was dashed repeatedly against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 小船一次又一次撞在岩石上。

sentences.english: When the doors opened, there was a mad dash for seats.
sentences.chinese: 门一开，人们便疯狂地朝座位奔去。

detailed_translations.english: to beat against a surface
an act of going somewhere suddenly and/or quickly

name: dazzling
trans: adj. 耀眼的；眼花缭乱的; v. 使…眼花

sentences.english: a dazzling display of football skills
sentences.chinese: 让人眼花缭乱的足球技巧表演

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人眼花缭乱的， 耀眼的
detailed_translations.english: a light that is dazzling is very bright and makes you unable to see properly for a short time

name: decent
trans: adj. 得体的；正派的；相当好的 副 词: decently

sentences.english: a decent burial
sentences.chinese: 得体的葬礼

sentences.english: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
sentences.chinese: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧，不太合乎高级讲师的身份。

sentences.english: The chairman did the decent thing (= did what people thought he ought to ) and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

detailed_translations.english: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

name: denote
trans: vt. 表示，指示 时 态: denoted, denoting, denotes 形容词: denotable

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: dense
trans: adj. 浓厚的；稠密的；愚钝的 比较级: denser, densest 副 词: densely 名 词: denseness

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: deplete
trans: vt. 〈正〉使大大的减少；使空虚时 态: depleted，depleting，depletes

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: depressed
trans: adj. 精神不振的,忧伤的,消沉的; 患抑郁症的; 经济萧条的,不景气的; 凹下的

sentences.english: Britain’s depressed housing market
sentences.chinese: 英国不景气的房产市场

sentences.english: She felt lonely and depressed .
sentences.chinese: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

detailed_translations.english: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity

name: derelict
trans: adj. 玩忽职守的；被抛弃了的；无主的; n. 遗弃物；玩忽职守者；被遗弃的人

sentences.english: Her body was found dumped in a derelict warehouse less than a mile from her home.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现丢在离她家不到一英里的一座废弃的仓库里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩忽职守的；无主的；被抛弃了的
detailed_translations.english: a derelict building or piece of land is in very bad condition because it has not been used for a long time

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗弃物；玩忽职守者；被遗弃的人

name: detective
trans: n. 侦探

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

name: devastate
trans: vt. 毁坏；使荒芜; 在感情上压垮 时 态: devastated，devastating，devastates 副 词: devastatingly 名 词: d...

sentences.english: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something very badly or completely

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径; 放大率 形容词: diametral

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: divorce
trans: vt. 使离婚，使分离；与…离婚; n. 离婚；分离; vi. 离婚 时 态: divorced, divorcing, divorces

sentences.english: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
sentences.chinese: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。

sentences.english: My father threatened to divorce her.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离婚； 分离， 脱离
detailed_translations.english: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
the legal ending of a marriage

name: domain
trans: n. 领域；产业；地产；域名

sentences.english: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
sentences.chinese: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

detailed_translations.english: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with

name: dominance
trans: n. 优势;支配地位;控制力

sentences.english: The latest fighting appears to be an attempt by each group to establish dominance over the other.
sentences.chinese: 最近的战斗似乎是冲突各方在试图争夺控制权。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being more powerful, more important, or more noticeable than other people or things

name: dose
trans: n. 剂量；一剂，一服; vi. 服药; vt. 给…服药；给药 时 态: dosed, dosing, doses 名 词: doser

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

name: drill
trans: n. 钻子；钻孔机；播种机；训练; vi. 钻孔；训练; vt. 训练；钻孔；条播 时 态: drilled, drilling, drills 名 词: driller

sentences.english: an electric drill
sentences.chinese: 电钻

sentences.english: rifle drill
sentences.chinese: 步枪操练

sentences.english: Drill a hole in each corner.
sentences.chinese: 在每个角上钻一个孔。

detailed_translations.english: a tool or machine used for making holes in something
to make a hole in something using a drill

name: echolocation
trans: n. 回声定位能力,回声定位法动 词: echolocate

sentences.english: Most bats navigate by echolocation.
sentences.chinese: 大多数蝙蝠通过回声定位飞行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回波定位；回声测距；回声定位能力（鲸和蝙蝠等所具备得一种机能）
detailed_translations.english: Echolocation is a system used by some animals to determine the position of an object by measuring how long it takes for an echo to return from the object

name: elusive
trans: adj. 难以捉摸的;难以找到的;不易记住的副 词: elusively

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: enquire
trans: vi. 询问；调查；问候; vt. 询问；打听

sentences.english: I am writing to confirm /enquire/inform you…
sentences.chinese: 我写信是要确认/询问/通知你…

sentences.english: I recently e-mailed one website to enquire why my goods had not yet arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我最近给一个网站发邮件去询问为什么我订购的商品还没有到达。

sentences.english: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, enquire who in it is worthy; and there abide till ye go thence.
sentences.chinese: 你们无论进那一城，那一村，要打听那里谁是好人，就住在他家，直住到走的时候。

name: entrepreneur
trans: n. 〈法〉企业家; 主办人 形容词: entrepreneurial 名 词: entrepreneurialism 名 词: entrepreneurship

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: eradicate
trans: vt. 摧毁，完全根除; n. 摧毁，根除; n. 根除者；褪色灵 时 态: eradicated，eradicating，eradicates 形容词: eradicabl...

sentences.english: an attempt to eradicate inflation
sentences.chinese: 为消除通货膨胀所作的努力

sentences.english: This problem has now been completely eradicated.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题现已彻底杜绝。

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

name: escalate
trans: vt. & vi. 逐步升级；逐步扩大; 更高，更大 时 态: escalated，escalating，escalates 名 词: escalation 形容词: ...

sentences.english: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
sentences.chinese: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: policies that escalate their own costs
sentences.chinese: 促使其自身成本增加的政策

sentences.english: escalating crime
sentences.chinese: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

detailed_translations.english: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this

name: evaporate
trans: vt. & vi. 蒸发掉; vi. 消失, 不复存在 时 态: evaporated, evaporating, evaporates 缩 写: evap 名 词: e...

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: evenly
trans: adv. 平坦地；均匀地；平等地；平衡地

sentences.english: The profits will be split evenly between the three of us.
sentences.chinese: 利润将由我们三人平分。

sentences.english: ‘I warned you not to phone me, ’ he said evenly.
sentences.chinese: “我告诫过你不要给我打电话。”他平静地说。

detailed_translations.english: divided in an equal way

name: exacerbate
trans: vt. 使恶化；使加重时 态: exacerbated，exacerbating，exacerbates 名 词: exacerbation

sentences.english: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
sentences.chinese: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。

sentences.english: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

detailed_translations.english: to make a bad situation worse

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识或技能

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: fade
trans: vt. & vi. 褪去, 变弱, 枯萎; vi. 逐渐消失 时 态: faded, fading, fades

sentences.english: the fading evening light
sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.english: The sun had faded the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

name: faint
trans: vi. 晕倒，昏倒; adj. 微弱的，模糊的，暗淡的; 无力的，虚弱的；易失去知觉的，昏眩的; 无力的，似无太大效果的; n. 昏倒 比较级: fainter，faintest ...

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

trans: n. 垃圾堆；垃圾填埋地; v. 将...埋在垃圾填埋地 时 态: landfilled, landfilling, landfills

trans: adj. 有磁性的, 有吸引力的; 磁性的 副 词: magnetically

sentences.chinese: 生活对我来说简直没什么意义。

sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
sentences.chinese: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。

sentences.english: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。

sentences.english: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
sentences.chinese: 我不想扫你的兴。

sentences.english: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

detailed_translations.english: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

name: sprawl
trans: vi. 伸开四肢坐〔躺〕; 蔓延；杂乱无序地拓展; 四肢伸展坐着; n. 杂乱无序拓展的地区; 随意扩展；蔓延；蔓延物 时 态: sprawled，sprawling，sprawls ...

sentences.english: He sprawled out on the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。

sentences.english: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一块石头绊了一下，四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。

sentences.english: a blow which sent him sprawling
sentences.chinese: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓延；伸开手足躺；无计划地扩展
detailed_translations.english: to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way

detailed_translations.chinese: 蔓生；伸开手足躺卧姿势

name: static
trans: adj. 静态的；静力的；静电的; n. 静电；静电干扰 形容词: statical 副 词: statically

sentences.english: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.
sentences.chinese: 获得各种资格证书的年轻人的数量一直保持不变或者已经减少。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is static does not move or change
noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV

name: stream
trans: n. 溪流；流动；光线；潮流; vi. 流；涌进；飘扬; vt. 流出；涌出；使飘动 时 态: streamed, streaming, streams 形容词: str...

sentences.english: Tears streamed down their faces.
sentences.chinese: 泪水顺着他们的脸颊流下来。

detailed_translations.english: to flow quickly and in great amounts
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river

name: stuff
trans: n. 材料；东西；填充物；素材资料; vt. 填塞；塞满；让吃饱; vi. 吃得过多 时 态: stuffed, stuffing, stuffs 名 词: stuffer

sentences.english: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.chinese: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.english: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.english: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.chinese: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

name: stunned
trans: adj. 受惊的; v. 使震惊；使不知所措

name: subsistence
trans: n. 存活, 生存, 维生之道形容词: subsistent

sentences.english: Many of the families are forced to live at the subsistence level.
sentences.chinese: 很多家庭被迫生活在基本生活水准线上。

sentences.english: The land provided subsistence and little more.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地只能提供人们的基本生活所需，别无富余。

detailed_translations.english: the condition of only just having enough money or food to stay alive

name: superb
trans: adj. 卓越的, 杰出的, 极好的副 词: superbly

sentences.english: The food was superb.
sentences.chinese: 食物好吃极了。

sentences.english: superb weather
sentences.chinese: 极好的天气

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: surveyor
trans: n. 测量员,勘测员，勘探员；鉴定人

sentences.english: ...the surveyor's maps of the Queen Alexandra Range.
sentences.chinese: …亚历山德拉皇后山脉勘测图。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to examine the condition of a building, or to measure and record the details of an area of land

name: sway
trans: vt. 使摇动；统治；影响; vi. 摇摆；影响; n. 摇摆；统治；影响 时 态: swayed, swaying, sways 名 词: swayer

sentences.english: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

detailed_translations.english: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

name: sympathetic
trans: adj. 表示同情的; 赞同的, 支持的 副 词: sympathetically

sentences.english: a sympathetic friend
sentences.chinese: 一个有同情心的朋友

sentences.english: a sympathetic attitude
sentences.chinese: 一种同情的态度

sentences.english: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (= someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

detailed_translations.english: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems

name: synthesis
trans: n. 综合, 综合法; 〈化〉合成 名 词: synthesist

sentences.english: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
sentences.chinese: 东西方哲学思想的结合

sentences.english: the synthesis of proteins
sentences.chinese: 蛋白质的合成

sentences.english: speech synthesis software
sentences.chinese: 语音合成软件

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合，综合物；（化学或生物学物质的）合成；（用电子方式对声音、语音或音乐的）合成
detailed_translations.english: something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

name: tease
trans: vt. & vi. 取笑, 戏弄; vt. 梳理; n. 爱嘲弄他人的人 时 态: teased, teasing, teases 副 词: teasingly

sentences.english: Don’t get upset. I was only teasing .
sentences.chinese: 别生气，我只是在逗你玩。

sentences.english: He used to tease her mercilessly .
sentences.chinese: 他过去总是无情地取笑她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取笑；戏弄；梳理；欺负；强求；使起毛
detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏弄；爱纠缠的小孩；挑逗者；卖弄风骚的女孩
detailed_translations.english: someone who enjoys making jokes at people, and embarrassing them, especially in a friendly way

name: telecommunication
trans: n. 电信

sentences.english: If large media and telecommunication companies decide to close their offerings to the web, I am convinced the web will route around it.
sentences.chinese: 如果大型媒体和电信公司决定停止向万维网提供内容，我很确信万维网会绕过这一点。

sentences.english: He became rich through his well diversified conglomerates which deal with oil, banking and telecommunication business in his homeland, Russia.
sentences.chinese: 他在他的祖国俄罗斯通过分类得当的联合企业集团以经营石油、银行业务及电信业务获得财富。

detailed_translations.english: the telegraphic or telephonic communication of audio, video, or digital information over a distance by means of radio waves, optical signals, etc, or along a transmission line

name: tempt
trans: vt. 引诱或怂恿干不正当的事; 使想要 时 态: tempted, tempting, tempts 形容词: temptable 名 词: tempter

sentences.english: If you leave valuables in your car it will tempt thieves.
sentences.chinese: 如果把贵重物品留在车上，会招来小偷的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

name: tenant
trans: n. 房客, 佃户, 承租人; 〈律〉占用者, 占有者 时 态: tenanted, tenanting, tenants

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: tilt
trans: vi. 倾斜；翘起；以言词或文字抨击; vt. 使倾斜；使翘起; n. 倾斜 时 态: tilted, tilting, tilts 名 词: tilter

sentences.english: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。

sentences.english: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
sentences.chinese: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

detailed_translations.english: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other

name: tough
trans: adj. 坚韧的; 坚强的; 粗暴的; 老的, 硬的; 严格的, 强硬的; 困难的 比较级: tougher, toughest 副 词: toughly 名 词: ...

sentences.english: It was a tough race.
sentences.chinese: 比赛打得很艰难。

sentences.english: She’s had a tough life.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活十分艰辛。

sentences.english: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
sentences.chinese: 公司承认那是艰难的一年。

sentences.english: Tough decisions will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 必须作出艰难的决定。

sentences.english: The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions .
sentences.chinese: 记者们问了很多难以回答的问题。

sentences.english: (= a difficult decision ) , but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管是一个艰难的决定，但由于天气不好我们只得取消比赛。

sentences.english: I find his books pretty tough going (= difficult to read ) .
sentences.chinese: 我发现他的书很难读。

sentences.english: Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (= something that is difficult to persuade someone about ) before Congress.
sentences.chinese: 盖奇预言总统的提议在国会很难通过。

detailed_translations.english: difficult to do or deal with

name: transaction
trans: n. 处理，办理，执行; 交易；事务 形容词: transactional

sentences.english: The bank charges a fixed rate for each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 银行对每一笔业务收取固定费用。

sentences.english: the transaction of government business
sentences.chinese: 处理政府事务

detailed_translations.english: a business deal or action, such as buying or selling something

name: transient
trans: adj. 短暂的; 片刻的; 转瞬即逝的

sentences.english: transient fashions
sentences.chinese: 短暂的时尚

detailed_translations.english: continuing only for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 瞬变现象；过往旅客；候鸟

name: transition
trans: n. 过渡; 转变; 变迁 v. (从某一状态或活动）转变，过度形容词: transitional 副 词: transitionally

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: trivial
trans: adj. 不重要的，琐碎的；琐细的 副 词: trivially

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

name: tropics
trans: n. 热带地区

name: underneath
trans: prep. 在…下面；在…底下; adv. 在下面; n. 底面，底部

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

name: unify
trans: vt. 统一；使相同，使一致 时 态: unified unifying, unifies 形容词: unifiable 名 词: unification 名...

sentences.english: Strong support for the war has unified the nation.
sentences.chinese: 对战争的坚决支持使这个国家团结了起来。

sentences.english: His music unifies traditional and modern themes.
sentences.chinese: 他的音乐结合了传统和现代的主题。

detailed_translations.english: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit

name: vacancy
trans: n. 空房间; 空虚；空白; 空缺；空职；空额; 空虚；失神，心不在焉

sentences.english: There are still two vacancies on the school board.
sentences.chinese: 学校董事会还有两个职位空缺。

sentences.english: The council is making every effort to fill the vacancies.
sentences.chinese: 地方议会正想方设法填补这些职缺。

sentences.english: information about job vacancies
sentences.chinese: 招聘信息

detailed_translations.english: a job that is available for someone to start doing

name: verdict
trans: n. 裁决, 裁定; 决定, 意见

sentences.english: The verdict was ‘not guilty’.
sentences.chinese: 裁决为“无罪”。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

name: waggle
trans: vi. 摇摆；不停地来回摇动; vt. 来回摇动；摆动; n. 摆动；摇摆 时 态: waggled, waggling, waggles 形容词: waggly

sentences.english: Can you waggle your ears?
sentences.chinese: 你的耳朵会动吗？

detailed_translations.english: to move something up and down or from side to side using short quick movements

name: well-being
trans: n. 康乐,安康;福利

sentences.english: Singing can create a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 唱歌能产生一种幸福感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 健康， 幸福； 福利
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy

name: withdraw
trans: vt. & vi. 取回; 撤退 时 态: withdrew withdrawn withdrawing, withdraws 形容词: withdrawable 名...

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: withstand
trans: vt. 经受, 承受时 态: withstood withstanding, withstands

sentences.english: The Chancellor has withstood the criticism and held firm.
sentences.chinese: 总理顶住批评，坚持立场。

detailed_translations.english: to defend yourself successfully against people who attack, criticize, or oppose you
